meanings.sent1: If you touch a cut with dirty hands, you may reinfect it.
meanings.sent2: The doctor warned the patient not to reinfect the wound by scratching it.
meanings.sent3: Tom accidentally reinfects his computer with a virus every time he opens suspicious emails.
meanings.sent4: The gossip spread so quickly that it seemed to reinfect the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The mold spores in the air can easily reinfect a damp area if not properly cleaned.

meanings.definition: To cause a person or animal to become infected with a disease again.
meanings.sent1: Please be careful not to reinfect others by not covering your mouth when you cough.
meanings.sent2: The contaminated water source could reinfect the entire village if not treated properly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to reinfect the house with fleas after the pest control treatment.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions could reinfect the entire herd with the contagious disease.
meanings.sent5: The lack of proper hygiene practices can easily reinfect a community with preventable illnesses.
